Description: Ostracon, large section of the shoulder of a red-brown pottery grooved jar, the interior is covered with a partially glittering dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394161) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394161)
